abstract: The row size style constants define the size of the rows in the table view. They are used by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/effectiveRowSizeStyle] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/rowSizeStyle-swift.property] properties. You can also query the row size in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableCellView] class’ property [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableCellView/rowSizeStyle].

# NSTableView.RowSizeStyle

**Enumeration**

The row size style constants define the size of the rows in the table view. They are used by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/effectiveRowSizeStyle] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/rowSizeStyle-swift.property] properties. You can also query the row size in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableCellView] class’ property [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableCellView/rowSizeStyle].

## Declaration

```swift
enum RowSizeStyle
```

## Constants

- **NSTableView.RowSizeStyle.default**: The table will use the system default layout size: small, medium or large.
- **NSTableView.RowSizeStyle.custom**: The table will use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/rowHeight] or invoke the delegate method [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableViewDelegate/tableView(_:heightOfRow:)], if implemented. The cell layout is not changed.
- **NSTableView.RowSizeStyle.small**: The table will use a row height specified for a small table. It is required that the size be fully tested and supported if `NSTableViewRowSizeStyleCustom` is not used.
- **NSTableView.RowSizeStyle.medium**: The table will use a row height specified for a medium table. It is required that the size be fully tested and supported if `NSTableViewRowSizeStyleCustom` is not used.
- **NSTableView.RowSizeStyle.large**: The table will use a row height specified for a large table. It is required that the size be fully tested and supported if `NSTableViewRowSizeStyleCustom` is not used.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Constants

- **Specifying a Custom Row View in a Nib File**: View-based table view instances use `NSTableViewRowKey` to identify the nib file containing the template row view. You can specify a custom row view (without any code) by associating this key with the appropriate nib name in Interface Builder.
- **NSTableView.DraggingDestinationFeedbackStyle**: These constants specify the drag styles displayed by the table view. They’re used by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/draggingDestinationFeedbackStyle-swift.property].
- **NSTableView.DropOperation**: `NSTableView` defines these constants to specify drop operations.
- **NSTableView.GridLineStyle**: `NSTableView` defines these constants to specify grid styles. These constants are used by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/gridStyleMask] property. The mask can be either [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableViewGridLineStyle/NSTableViewGridNone] or it can contain either or both of the other options combined using the C bitwise `OR` operator.
- **NSTableView.ColumnAutoresizingStyle**: The following constants specify the autoresizing styles. These constants are used by the  [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/columnAutoresizingStyle-swift.property] property.
- **NSTableView.SelectionHighlightStyle**: The following constants specify the selection highlight styles. These constants are used by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/selectionHighlightStyle-swift.property] property.
- **NSTableView.AnimationOptions**: Specifies the animation effects to apply when inserting or removing rows.
- **NSTableView.RowActionEdge**: These constants define table row edges on which row actions are attached. They are used by the `tableView:rowActionsForRow:edge:` delegate method.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
